round_best: Develop a dynamic balancing algorithm that adaptively adjusts the weighting between distortion and perceptual quality metrics during the training of image restoration models based on the input image characteristics. This algorithm would use reinforcement learning to tune the weights in real-time, learning from the degree of degradation and content type in the images. By optimizing weights dynamically, the model can provide tailor-made restoration that optimally balances sharpness and naturalness specific to each image, potentially yielding superior results where static weighting schemes fail.

round_best: Propose a dual-pathway deep learning model that processes an image through two parallel paths, each optimized for either distortion minimization or perceptual quality enhancement. The outputs of these paths are then fused using a learned aggregation module that considers the contextual and content-specific attributes of the input image, aiming for a balanced restoration output.
